quotes.quote: In the past, people were born royal. Nowadays, royalty comes from what you do.
There's nothing so kingly as kindness, and nothing so royal as truth.
Being born into the Royal Family is like being born into a mental asylum. Marrying into it is not something to be taken lightly.
There are no galley-slaves in the royal vessel of divine love - every man works his oar voluntarily!
Be Royal in your on own fashion. Act like a King to be treated.
Poems, like dreams, are a sort of royal road to the unconcious. They tell you what your secret self cannot express.
The institution of royalty in any form is an insult to the human race.
To the royal guards of this realm, we are all victims in-waiting.
Royal blood isn't blue, it is a jaundiced shade of red and riddled with broken chromosomes.
All kings and queens are not born of royal bloodlines. Some become royal because of what they do once they realize who they are.
What we need is a royal army of returned missionaries reenlisted into service.
The interpretation of dreams is the royal road to a knowledge of the unconscious activities of the mind.
The royal road to a man's heart is to talk to him about the things he treasures most.
There is no royal road to a successful life, as there is no royal road to learning. It has got to be hard knocks, morning, noon, and night, and fixity of purpose.
There is no royal road to geometry.
Historically, royal families have represented an institution. The institution is built on heritage, and is timeless in that sense.
There is no royal road to learning; no short cut to the acquirement of any art.
For a sailor used to travelling light and looking after himself, many aspects of life as a royal came as an unpleasant shock to Prince Philip.
There is only one royal road for the spiritual journey ... Love.
Dreams are the royal road to the unconcious.
Winning the Royal Rumble is as big an accomplishment as anything.
The Royal Crown cures not the headache.
And now run the race which is set before thee, in the royal way of universal love.
